other_tests.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left; right atrium and ventricle are enlarged; coarse densities within the liver likely calcifications; numerous hepatic hypodensities likely cysts; mild intrahepatic and extrahepatic ductal dilation with common bile duct measuring up to 9 mm; gallbladder contains numerous large stones with extensive pericholecystic fluid, mucosal enhancement, and irregularity; possible gallbladder wall perforation; thickening of the left adrenal gland without focal nodule; partially fatty replaced pancreas with dilated distal pancreatic duct at 9 mm; small right kidney hypodensities likely renal cysts; no free air in abdomen; diveritcula of descending and sigmoid colon without diverticulitis; urinary bladder normal; coarse calcifications in uterus likely due to calcified leiomyomata.
